Items.Name: BountyCount
Documentation: Number of bounty proposals that have been made.

Items.Name: BountyApprovals
Documentation: Bounty indices that have been approved but not yet funded.

Calls.Name: propose_bounty
Documentation: The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_.
Payment: `TipReportDepositBase` will be reserved from the origin account, as well as
`DataDepositPerByte` for each byte in `reason`. It will be unreserved upon approval,
- `curator`: The curator account whom will manage this bounty.
- `value`: The total payment amount of this bounty, curator fee included.

Calls.Name: approve_bounty
Documentation: Approve a bounty proposal. At a later time, the bounty will be funded and become active
and the original deposit will be returned.

Calls.Name: propose_curator
Documentation: Assign a curator to a funded bounty.

Calls.Name: unassign_curator
Documentation: This function can only be called by the `RejectOrigin` a signed origin.
If this function is called by the `RejectOrigin`, we assume that the curator is malicious
or inactive. As a result, we will slash the curator when possible.
If the origin is the curator, we take this as a sign they are unable to do their job and
they willingly give up. We could slash them, but for now we allow them to recover their
deposit and exit without issue. (We may want to change this if it is abused.)
Finally, the origin can be anyone if and only if the curator is "inactive". This allows
anyone in the community to call out that a curator is not doing their due diligence, and
we should pick a new curator. In this case the curator should also be slashed.

Calls.Name: accept_curator
Documentation: Accept the curator role for a bounty.
A deposit will be reserved from curator and refund upon successful payout.
May only be called from the curator.

Calls.Name: award_bounty
Documentation: Award bounty to a beneficiary account. The beneficiary will be able to claim the funds after a delay.
The dispatch origin for this call must be the curator of this bounty.
- `beneficiary`: The beneficiary account whom will receive the payout.

Calls.Name: claim_bounty
Documentation: Claim the payout from an awarded bounty after payout delay.
The dispatch origin for this call must be the beneficiary of this bounty.

Calls.Name: close_bounty
Documentation: Cancel a proposed or active bounty. All the funds will be sent to treasury and
the curator deposit will be unreserved if possible.
Only `T::RejectOrigin` is able to cancel a bounty.

Calls.Name: extend_bounty_expiry
Documentation: Extend the expiry time of an active bounty.
The dispatch origin for this call must be the curator of this bounty.

Events.Name: BountyRejected
Documentation: A bounty proposal was rejected; funds were slashed. \[index, bond\]

Events.Name: BountyBecameActive
Documentation: A bounty proposal is funded and became active. \[index\]

Events.Name: BountyAwarded
Documentation: A bounty is awarded to a beneficiary. \[index, beneficiary\]

Events.Name: BountyClaimed
Documentation: A bounty is claimed by beneficiary. \[index, payout, beneficiary\]

Constants.Name: DataDepositPerByte
Documentation: The amount held on deposit per byte within bounty description.

Constants.Name: BountyDepositBase
Documentation: The amount held on deposit for placing a bounty proposal.

Constants.Name: BountyDepositPayoutDelay
Documentation: The delay period for which a bounty beneficiary need to wait before claim the payout.

Constants.Name: BountyCuratorDeposit
Documentation: Percentage of the curator fee that will be reserved upfront as deposit for bounty curator.

Errors.Name: InvalidIndex
Documentation: No proposal or bounty at that index.

Errors.Name: ReasonTooBig
Documentation: The reason given is just too big.

Errors.Name: PendingPayout
Documentation: To cancel the bounty, you must unassign and slash the curator.

Errors.Name: Premature
Documentation: The bounties cannot be claimed/closed because it's still in the countdown period.
